Both films are engaging and offer unique perspectives on different walks of life. Enjoy the cinematic journey!

Another film worth mentioning is "The Messenger", which tells a poignant story about an American soldier dealing with an ethical dilemma while involved with a widow of a fallen officer. Starring Woody Harrelson and Ben Foster, it's a powerful drama that I believe you might appreciate as well. Enjoy your movie time!

Alternatively, if you're intrigued by a unique blend of fantasy and reality, "Alex in Wonderland" directed by Paul Mazursky might be up your alley. Starring Dustin Hoffman and Tom Cruise, this film tells the tale of a self-centered yuppie who discovers his estranged father left a fortune to an autistic brother he didn't know existed. The journey across country they embark on together is both heartwarming and thought-provoking.

Another interesting film you might enjoy is "The Age of Innocence" set in the 19th century New York high society, with a star-studded cast including Geraldine Chaplin, Richard E. Grant, and Martin Scorsese among others. The film delves into complex themes of love, family, and societal expectations.
